intro: Tetranthera nemoralis, commonly known as the common tetranthera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Tetranthera nemoralis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
